grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 袖手傍観【シュウシュボウカン】looking on with folded arms (with one's hands in one's sleeves), remaining a passive onlooker
袖珍本【シュウチンボン】pocket-size book
領袖【リョウシュウ】leader, chief, boss
kun reading compounds: 袖【そで】sleeve, wing (of a stage, desk, gate, etc.)
袖裏【そでうら】lining of a sleeve, sleeve lining
小袖【こそで】short sleeved kimono (worn as an undergarment during Heian period), padded silk garment
